vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/da68ce1b-acae-497b-a546-77da3769b001">SPOUSES</keyword>         <topcClas>Family life and marriage - Social stratification and groupings</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>This project used data from the <i>British Household Panel Survey</i> (BHPS) (available at the UKDA under SN 5151), to compile a dataset of variables relating to the starting, ending date and type of each union (cohabitation or legal marriage) of members of the BHPS. Evidence derived from the answers provided by both partners at each wave has been used. The dataset has been created on the basis of Chiara Pronzato's project which reconstructed union and childbirth histories from both retrospective and annual interviews (available at the UKDA under SN 5629). <br> <br> Further information about the project is available from the ESRC's <a href="http://www.esrc.ac.uk/my-esrc/grants/RES-061-23-0127/read" title ="Are storks striking for a contract renewal? Childbirth under changing employment, family and welfare arrangements">Are storks striking for a contract renewal? Childbirth under changing employment, family and welfare arrangements</a> award webpage.<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>Inconsistencies across answers provided by both partners or across time, as well as missing information found in those data with respect to the union histories of respondents has been corrected and harmonized, where possible. Both original data and proposed corrections are maintained to grant researchers the option to revert each choice (details about the guiding principles followed are to be found in the documentation). The dataset also contains a single identifier for each union (between the same two partners) ever present (and identified) in at least one wave of the panel.</abstract>       <sumDscr>         <collDate event="start" date="1991-01-01T00:00:00Z">1991</collDate>         <collDate event="end" date="2006-01-01T00:00:00Z">2006</collDate>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>Government Office Regions</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Individuals</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Respondents to the BHPS Waves 1-15 (1991-2006).</universe>         <dataKind>Numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Longitudinal/panel/cohort</timeMeth>         <sampProc>See main BHPS documentation for details of sampling.</sampProc>         <deviat>31,552 cases</deviat>         <collMode>Compilation or synthesis of existing material</collMode>         <sources>           <dataSrc>The study uses data from the following two studies available from the UKDA:<ul><li>SN 5151 - British Household Panel Survey: Waves 1-15, 1991-2006</li><li>SN 5629 -British Household Panel Survey Consolidated Marital, Cohabitation and Fertility Histories, 1991-2006</li></ul></dataSrc>         </sources>         <weight>See main BHPS documentation for details of BHPS weighting.</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Standard conditions of access</specPerm>         <restrctn>The depositor has specified that registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage.
